content.description: Start the same as Twister with a flat right hand slot and a left sloping edge. Big move up to the jug, then move up and left through the juggy crack. Top out above the crack. Guidebook grade is V1, but this line has an airy top-out and the first move is pretty hard for V1.
content.location: Right side of Twisted Tree Boulder.

content.description: The main event on the Twisted boulder starts on the right side of the aspect facing the road at a flat edge. Move left past some increasingly greasy slopers and up to better holds.
content.protection: A few pads for a rather uneven, rocky landing. A brush for those slopers.
content.location: On the side facing the road, find the furthest right edge in the line of uber chalky holds.

content.description: Start on the low 2 hand jug directly left of the tree. Some crimping, some heel hooking, and a somewhat imaginary right hand hold will lead you to the jug above. From here, find some way to press out a mantle and get yourself up and onto the victory slab to an easy top-out.
content.protection: It starts low but there are some sharp rocks in the way so at least 2 pads should hypothetically make one feel safe enough.
content.location: Immediately left of the tree on the giant flake/jug

content.description: From the guidebook: start with the big sidepull on the uphill face of boulder.
content.location: Twisted Tree area. A short walk up the hill (away from the road) from Twisted Tree boulder. This boulder also features Nuthin' to the left, and Little One on the adjacent boulder.

content.description: Sart on the high chalked jug and move right and up through some okay holds. Harder top-out for the grade.
content.location: Around the corner from the Twisted Tree.

content.description: Crouch start with compression using crimps up the arete to a mellow top out. Short, bu fun moves with a nice landing.
content.location: About 50 yards behind Twisted Tree boulder.

content.description: Start on the low 2 hand jug directly left of the tree. From here, some crimping and some heel hooking will lead you to a bad sloper above and slightly to the left of the starting jug. Keep trending left on crimps that get smaller and smaller and then find some way to press out a tough mantle to get up on the slab about 5 feet or so left of the tree.
content.protection: Low start but there are a good deal of sharp rocks so you really want either 3 or more pads to cover everything or a good and attentive spotter moving pads for you as you trend left.
content.location: Shares a start with "Twisted Tree" but trends left through a sloper and some small crimps.

content.description: Work up the prow, pressing out for the mantle. A couple variations to start, but apparently the same grade. Fun moves but short problem.
content.location: About 50 yards behind Twisted Tree boulder, just right of Sumthin boulder.
